Description: The AWS Foundational Security Best Practices standard is a set of controls that detect when your deployed accounts and resources deviate from security best practices.

Requirements.Name: Imported ACM certificates should be renewed after a specified time period
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether ACM certificates in your account are marked for expiration within 30 days. It checks both imported certificates and certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ACM resources.

Requirements.Name: RSA certificates managed by ACM should use a key length of at least 2,048 bits
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether RSA certificates managed by AWS Certificate Manager use a key length of at least 2,048 bits. The control fails if the key length is smaller than 2,048 bits.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ACM resources.

Requirements.Name: API Gateway REST and WebSocket API logging should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether all stages of an Amazon API Gateway REST or WebSocket API have logging enabled. The control fails if logging is not enabled for all methods of a stage or if loggingLevel is neither ERROR nor INFO.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: API Gateway REST API stages should be configured to use SSL certificates for backend authentication
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway REST API stages have SSL certificates configured. Backend systems use these certificates to authenticate that incoming requests are from API Gateway.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: API Gateway REST API stages should have AWS X-Ray tracing enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether AWS X-Ray active tracing is enabled for your Amazon API Gateway REST API stages.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: API Gateway should be associated with an AWS WAF web ACL
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an API Gateway stage uses an AWS WAF web access control list (ACL). This control fails if an AWS WAF web ACL is not attached to a REST API Gateway stage.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: API Gateway REST API cache data should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether all methods in API Gateway REST API stages that have cache enabled are encrypted. The control fails if any method in an API Gateway REST API stage is configured to cache and the cache is not encrypted.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: API Gateway routes should specify an authorization type
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway routes have an authorization type. The control fails if the API Gateway route does not specify an authorization type.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: Access logging should be configured for API Gateway V2 Stages
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway V2 stages have access logging configured. This control fails if access log settings aren't defined.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring API Gateway resources.

Requirements.Name: Security contact information should be provided for an AWS account
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account has security contact information. The control fails if security contact information is not provided for the account.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Account resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS AppSync API caches should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync API cache is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the API cache isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring AppSync resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS AppSync should have field-level logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync API has field-level logging turned on. The control fails if the field resolver log level is set to None. Unless you provide custom parameter values to indicate that a specific log type should be enabled, Security Hub produces a passed finding if the field resolver log level is either ERROR or ALL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring AppSync resources.

Requirements.Name: Athena workgroups should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an Athena workgroup is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an Athena workgroup isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Athena resources.

Requirements.Name: Auto Scaling groups associated with a load balancer should use load balancer health checks
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your Auto Scaling groups that are associated with a load balancer are using Elastic Load Balancing health checks. This ensures that the group can determine an instance's health based on additional tests provided by the load balancer. Using Elastic Load Balancing health checks can help support the availability of applications that use EC2 Auto Scaling groups.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group should cover multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Auto Scaling group spans multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if an Auto Scaling group does not span multiple availability zones.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: Auto Scaling group should configure EC2 instances to require Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether IMDSv2 is enabled on all instances launched by Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups. The control fails if the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) version is not included in the launch configuration or if both IMDSv1 and IMDSv2 are enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: Auto Scaling group launch configuration should not have metadata response hop limit greater than 1
Requirements.Description: This control checks the number of network hops that a metadata token can travel. The control fails if the metadata response hop limit is greater than 1.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EC2 instances launched using Auto Scaling group launch configurations should not have Public IP addresses
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Auto Scaling groups associated launch configuration assigns a public IP address to the group's instances.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: Auto Scaling groups should use multiple instance types in multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group uses multiple instance types. The control fails if the Auto Scaling group has only one instance type defined.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 Auto Scaling groups should use EC2 launch templates
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is created from an EC2 launch template. This control fails if an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is not created with a launch template or if a launch template is not specified in a mixed instances policy.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Auto Scaling resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS Backup recovery points should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an AWS Backup recovery point is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the recovery point isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Backup resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFormation stacks should be integrated with Simple Notification Service (SNS)
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Simple Notification Service notification is integrated with a CloudFormation stack. The control fails for a CloudFormation stack if there is no SNS notification associated with it.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFormation resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should have a default root object configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured to return a specific object that is the default root object. The control fails if the CloudFront distribution does not have a default root object configured.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should require encryption in transit
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution requires viewers to use HTTPS directly or whether it uses redirection. The control fails if ViewerProtocolPolicy is set to allow-all for defaultCacheBehavior or for cacheBehaviors.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should have origin failover configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured with an origin group that has two or more origins. CloudFront origin failover can increase availability. Origin failover automatically redirects traffic to a secondary origin if the primary origin is unavailable or if it returns specific HTTP response status codes.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should have logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether server access logging is enabled on CloudFront distributions. The control fails if access logging is not enabled for a distribution.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should have AWS WAF enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether CloudFront distributions are associated with either AWS WAF or AWS WAFv2 web ACLs. The control fails if the distribution is not associated with a web ACL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should use custom SSL/TLS certificates
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether CloudFront distributions are using the default SSL/TLS certificate CloudFront provides. This control passes if the CloudFront distribution uses a custom SSL/TLS certificate. This control fails if the CloudFront distribution uses the default SSL/TLS certificate.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should use SNI to serve HTTPS requests
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon CloudFront distributions are using a custom SSL/TLS certificate and are configured to use SNI to serve HTTPS requests. This control fails if a custom SSL/TLS certificate is associated but the SSL/TLS support method is a dedicated IP address.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should encrypt traffic to custom origins
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon CloudFront distributions are encrypting traffic to custom origins. This control fails for a CloudFront distribution whose origin protocol policy allows 'http-only'. This control also fails if the distribution's origin protocol policy is 'match-viewer' while the viewer protocol policy is 'allow-all'.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should not use deprecated SSL protocols between edge locations and custom origins
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon CloudFront distributions are using deprecated SSL protocols for HTTPS communication between CloudFront edge locations and your custom origins. This control fails if a CloudFront distribution has a CustomOriginConfig where OriginSslProtocols includes SSLv3.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should not point to non-existent S3 origins
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon CloudFront distributions are pointing to non-existent Amazon S3 origins. The control fails for a CloudFront distribution if the origin is configured to point to a non-existent bucket. This control only applies to CloudFront distributions where an S3 bucket without static website hosting is the S3 origin.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudFront distributions should use origin access control
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution with an Amazon S3 origin has origin access control (OAC) configured. The control fails if OAC isn't configured for the CloudFront distribution.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudFront resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudTrail should be enabled and configured with at least one multi-Region trail
Requirements.Description: This control checks that there is at least one multi-Region CloudTrail trail.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: CloudTrail should have encryption at rest enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether CloudTrail is configured to use the server-side encryption (SSE) AWS Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) encryption. The check passes if the KmsKeyId is defined.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: At least one CloudTrail trail should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS CloudTrail trail is enabled in your AWS account. The control fails if your account doesn't have at least one CloudTrail trail enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: Ensure CloudTrail log file validation is enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether log file integrity validation is enabled on a CloudTrail trail. CloudTrail log file validation creates a digitally signed digest file that contains a hash of each log that CloudTrail writes to Amazon S3. You can use these digest files to determine whether a log file was changed, deleted, or unchanged after CloudTrail delivered the log.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: Ensure CloudTrail trails are integrated with Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether CloudTrail trails are configured to send logs to CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn property of the trail is empty.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: Ensure the S3 bucket used to store CloudTrail logs is not publicly accessible
Requirements.Description: CloudTrail logs a record of every API call made in your account. These log files are stored in an S3 bucket. CIS recommends that the S3 bucket policy, or access control list (ACL), applied to the S3 bucket that CloudTrail logs to prevents public access to the CloudTrail logs. Allowing public access to CloudTrail log content might aid an adversary in identifying weaknesses in the affected account's use or configuration.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: Ensure S3 bucket access logging is enabled on the CloudTrail S3 bucket
Requirements.Description: S3 bucket access logging generates a log that contains access records for each request made to your S3 bucket. An access log record contains details about the request, such as the request type, the resources specified in the request worked, and the time and date the request was processed.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CloudTrail resources.

Requirements.Name: CodeBuild Bitbucket source repository URLs should not contain sensitive credentials
Requirements.Description: Authentication credentials should never be stored or transmitted in clear text or appear in the repository URL. Instead of personal access tokens or user name and password, you should use OAuth to grant authorization for accessing GitHub or Bitbucket repositories. Using personal access tokens or a user name and password could expose your credentials to unintended data exposure and unauthorized access.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CodeBuild resources.

Requirements.Name: CodeBuild project environment variables should not contain clear text credentials
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the project contains the environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY. Authentication credentials AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY should never be stored in clear text, as this could lead to unintended data exposure and unauthorized access.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CodeBuild resources.

Requirements.Name: CodeBuild S3 logs should be encrypted
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon S3 logs for an AWS CodeBuild project are encrypted. The control fails if encryption is deactivated for S3 logs for a CodeBuild project.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CodeBuild resources.

Requirements.Name: CodeBuild project environments should have a logging configuration
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a CodeBuild project environment has at least one log option, either to S3 or CloudWatch logs enabled. This control fails if a CodeBuild project environment does not have at least one log option enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CodeBuild resources.

Requirements.Name: CodeBuild project environments should not have privileged mode enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an AWS CodeBuild project environment has privileged mode enabled. This control fails when an AWS CodeBuild project environment has privileged mode enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CodeBuild resources.

Requirements.Name: CodeBuild report group exports should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the test results of an AWS CodeBuild report group that are exported to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket are encrypted at rest. The control fails if the report group export isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring CodeBuild resources.

Requirements.Name: Cognito user pools should have threat protection activated with full function enforcement mode for standard authentication
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Cognito user pool has threat protection activated with the enforcement mode set to full function. The control fails if the user pool has threat protection deactivated or if the enforcement mode isn't set to full function. Unless you provide custom parameter values, Security Hub uses the default value of ENFORCED for enforcement mode set to full function.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Cognito resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS Config should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether AWS Config is enabled in the account for the local Region and is recording all resources. The AWS Config service performs configuration management of supported AWS resources in your account and delivers log files to you. The recorded information includes the configuration item (AWS resource), relationships between configuration items, and any configuration changes between resources.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Config resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS Database Migration Service replication instances should not be public
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether AWS DMS replication instances are public. To do this, it examines the value of the PubliclyAccessible field. A private replication instance has a private IP address that you cannot access outside of the replication network. A replication instance should have a private IP address when the source and target databases are in the same network. The network must also be connected to the replication instance's VPC using a VPN, AWS Direct Connect, or VPC peering. To learn more about public and private replication instances, see Public and private replication instances in the AWS Database Migration Service User Guide.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DMS resources.

Requirements.Name: DMS replication instances should have automatic minor version upgrade enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrade is enabled for an AWS DMS replication instance. The control fails if automatic minor version upgrade isn't enabled for a DMS replication instance.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DMS resources.

Requirements.Name: DMS replication tasks for the target database should have logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled with the minimum severity level of LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT for DMS replication tasks TARGET_APPLY and TARGET_LOAD. The control fails if logging isn't enabled for these tasks or if the minimum severity level is less than LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DMS resources.

Requirements.Name: DMS replication tasks for the source database should have logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled with the minimum severity level of LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT for DMS replication tasks SOURCE_CAPTURE and SOURCE_UNLOAD. The control fails if logging isn't enabled for these tasks or if the minimum severity level is less than LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DMS resources.

Requirements.Name: DMS endpoints should use SSL
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS DMS endpoint uses an SSL connection. The control fails if the endpoint doesn't use SSL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DMS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an Amazon DocumentDB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DocumentDB resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should have an adequate backup retention period
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster has a backup retention period greater than or equal to 7 days. The control fails if the backup retention period is less than 7 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DocumentDB resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon DocumentDB manual cluster snapshots should not be public
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB manual cluster snapshot is public. The control fails if the manual cluster snapshot is public.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DocumentDB resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster publishes audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the cluster doesn't publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DocumentDB resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should have deletion protection enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if the cluster doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DocumentDB resources.

Requirements.Name: DynamoDB tables should automatically scale capacity with demand
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DynamoDB table can scale its read and write capacity as needed. This control passes if the table uses either on-demand capacity mode or provisioned mode with auto scaling configured. Scaling capacity with demand avoids throttling exceptions, which helps to maintain availability of your applications.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DynamoDB resources.

Requirements.Name: DynamoDB tables should have point-in-time recovery enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether point-in-time recovery (PITR) is enabled for an Amazon DynamoDB table. Backups help you to recover more quickly from a security incident. They also strengthen the resilience of your systems. DynamoDB point-in-time recovery automates backups for DynamoDB tables. It reduces the time to recover from accidental delete or write operations. DynamoDB tables that have PITR enabled can be restored to any point in time in the last 35 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DynamoDB resources.

Requirements.Name: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a DAX cluster is encrypted at rest. Encrypting data at rest reduces the risk of data stored on disk being accessed by a user not authenticated to AWS. The encryption adds another set of access controls to limit the ability of unauthorized users to access to the data. For example, API permissions are required to decrypt the data before it can be read.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DynamoDB resources.

Requirements.Name: DynamoDB tables should be present in a backup plan
Requirements.Description: This control evaluates whether an Amazon DynamoDB table in ACTIVE state is covered by a backup plan. The control fails if the DynamoDB table isn't covered by a backup plan. If you set the backupVaultLockCheck parameter equal to true, the control passes only if the DynamoDB table is backed up in an AWS Backup locked vault.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DynamoDB resources.

Requirements.Name: DynamoDB tables should have deletion protection enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DynamoDB table has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if a DynamoDB table doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DynamoDB resources.

Requirements.Name: DynamoDB Accelerator clusters should be encrypted in transit
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster is encrypted in transit, with the endpoint encryption type set to TLS. The control fails if the DAX cluster isn't encrypted in transit.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring DynamoDB resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EBS snapshots should not be public, determined by the ability to be restorable by anyone
Requirements.Description: Amazon EBS snapshots should not be public, determined by the ability to be restorable by anyone. EBS snapshots are used to back up the data on your EBS volumes to Amazon S3 at a specific point in time. You can use the snapshots to restore previous states of EBS volumes. It is rarely acceptable to share a snapshot with the public. Typically the decision to share a snapshot publicly was made in error or without a complete understanding of the implications. This check helps ensure that all such sharing was fully planned and intentional.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: VPC default security groups should not allow inbound or outbound traffic
Requirements.Description: This control checks that the default security group of a VPC does not allow inbound or outbound traffic. The rules for the default security group allow all outbound and inbound traffic from network interfaces (and their associated instances) that are assigned to the same security group.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Attached EBS volumes should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the EBS volumes that are in an attached state are encrypted. To pass this check, EBS volumes must be in use and encrypted. If the EBS volume is not attached, then it is not subject to this check.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Stopped EC2 instances should be removed after a specified time period
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether any EC2 instances have been stopped for more than the allowed number of days. An EC2 instance fails this check if it is stopped for longer than the maximum allowed time period, which by default is 30 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: VPC flow logging should be enabled in all VPCs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon VPC Flow Logs are found and enabled for VPCs. The traffic type is set to Reject. With the VPC Flow Logs feature, you can capture information about the IP address traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you create a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in CloudWatch Logs. To reduce cost, you can also send your flow logs to Amazon S3.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EBS default encryption should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether account-level encryption is enabled by default for Amazon Elastic Block Store(Amazon EBS). The control fails if the account level encryption is not enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 instances should use IMDSv2
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your EC2 instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 instances should not have a public IP address
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether EC2 instances have a public IP address. The control fails if the publicIp field is present in the EC2 instance configuration item. This control applies to IPv4 addresses only.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EC2 should be configured to use VPC endpoints
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a service endpoint for Amazon EC2 is created for each VPC. The control fails if a VPC does not have a VPC endpoint created for the Amazon EC2 service.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Unused Amazon EC2 EIPs should be removed
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Elastic IP (EIP) addresses that are allocated to a VPC are attached to EC2 instances or in-use elastic network interfaces (ENIs).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Security groups should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to port 22
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to port 22. The control fails if the security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to port 22.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Security groups should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to port 3389
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to port 3389. The control fails if the security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to port 3389.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 subnets should not automatically assign public IP addresses
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the assignment of public IPs in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) subnets have MapPublicIpOnLaunch set to FALSE. The control passes if the flag is set to FALSE.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Unused network access control lists should be removed
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether there are any unused network access control lists (ACLs). The control checks the item configuration of the resource AWS::EC2::NetworkAcl and determines the relationships of the network ACL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 instances should not use multiple ENIs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an EC2 instance uses multiple Elastic Network Interfaces (ENIs) or Elastic Fabric Adapters (EFAs). This control passes if a single network adapter is used. The control includes an optional parameter list to identify the allowed ENIs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Security groups should only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the security groups that are in use allow unrestricted incoming traffic. Optionally the rule checks whether the port numbers are listed in the authorizedTcpPorts parameter. The default values for authorizedTcpPorts are 80 and 443.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Security groups should not allow unrestricted access to ports with high risk
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether unrestricted incoming traffic for the security groups is accessible to the specified ports that have the highest risk. This control passes when none of the rules in a security group allow ingress traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 for those ports.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection should be up
Requirements.Description: This control checks that both VPN tunnels provided by AWS Site-to-Site VPN are in UP status. The control fails if one or both tunnels are in DOWN status.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Network ACLs should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
Requirements.Description: This control checks if default ports for SSH/RDP ingress traffic for network access control lists (NACLs) is unrestricted. The rule fails if a NACL inbound entry allows a source CIDR block of '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' for ports 22 or 3389.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: [RETIRED] Unused Amazon EC2 security groups should be removed
Requirements.Description: This control checks if default ports for SSH/RDP ingress traffic for network access control lists (NACLs) is unrestricted. The rule fails if a NACL inbound entry allows a source CIDR block of '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' for ports 22 or 3389.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 Transit Gateways should not automatically accept VPC attachment requests
Requirements.Description: This control checks if EC2 Transit Gateways are automatically accepting shared VPC attachments. This control fails for a Transit Gateway that automatically accepts shared VPC attachment requests.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Paravirtual EC2 instance types should not be used
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the virtualization type of an EC2 instance is paravirtual. The control fails if the virtualizationType of the EC2 instance is set to paravirtual.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EC2 launch templates should not assign public IPs to network interfaces
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured to assign public IP addresses to network interfaces upon launch. The control fails if an EC2 launch template is configured to assign a public IP address to network interfaces or if there is at least one network interface that has a public IP address.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EBS volumes should be covered by a backup plan
Requirements.Description: This control evaluates if an Amazon EBS volume in in-use state is covered by a backup plan. The control fails if an EBS volume isn't covered by a backup plan. If you set the backupVaultLockCheck parameter equal to true, the control passes only if the EBS volume is backed up in an AWS Backup locked vault.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 Client VPN endpoints should have client connection logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Client VPN endpoint has client connection logging enabled. The control fails if the endpoint doesn't have client connection logging enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EC2 resources.

Requirements.Name: ECR private repositories should have image scanning configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has image scanning configured. This control fails if a private ECR repository doesn't have image scanning configured.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECR resources.

Requirements.Name: ECR private repositories should have tag immutability configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has tag immutability enabled. This control fails if a private ECR repository has tag immutability disabled. This rule passes if tag immutability is enabled and has the value IMMUTABLE.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECR resources.

Requirements.Name: ECR repositories should have at least one lifecycle policy configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ECR repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured. This control fails if an ECR repository does not have any lifecycle policies configured.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECR resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon ECS task definitions should have secure networking modes and user definitions
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ECS task definition that has host networking mode also has 'privileged' or 'user' container definitions. The control fails for task definitions that have host network mode and container definitions where privileged=false or is empty and user=root or is empty.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon ECS services should not have public IP addresses assigned to them automatically
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon ECS services are configured to automatically assign public IP addresses. This control fails if AssignPublicIP is ENABLED. This control passes if AssignPublicIP is DISABLED.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: ECS task definitions should not share the host's process namespace
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon ECS task definitions are configured to share a hostâs process namespace with its containers. The control fails if the task definition shares the host's process namespace with the containers running on it.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: ECS containers should run as non-privileged
Requirements.Description: This control checks if the privileged parameter in the container definition of Amazon ECS Task Definitions is set to true. The control fails if this parameter is equal to true.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: ECS containers should be limited to read-only access to root filesystems
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ECS containers are limited to read-only access to mounted root filesystems. This control fails if the ReadonlyRootFilesystem parameter in the container definition of ECS task definitions is set to false.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: Secrets should not be passed as container environment variables
Requirements.Description: This control checks if the key value of any variables in the environment parameter of container definitions includes AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, or ECS_ENGINE_AUTH_DATA. This control fails if a single environment variable in any container definition equals AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, or ECS_ENGINE_AUTH_DATA. This control does not cover environmental variables passed in from other locations such as Amazon S3.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: ECS task definitions should have a logging configuration
Requirements.Description: This control checks if the latest active Amazon ECS task definition has a logging configuration specified. The control fails if the task definition doesn't have the logConfiguration property defined or if the value for logDriver is null in at least one container definition.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: Fargate services should run on the latest Fargate platform version
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon ECS Fargate services are running the latest Fargate platform version. This control fails if the platform version is not the latest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: ECS clusters should have Container Insights enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ECS clusters use Container Insights. This control fails if Container Insights are not set up for a cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ECS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EFS should be configured to encrypt file data at rest using AWS KMS
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System is configured to encrypt the file data using AWS KMS.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EFS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EFS volumes should be in backup plans
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file systems are added to the backup plans in AWS Backup. The control fails if Amazon EFS file systems are not included in the backup plans.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EFS resources.

Requirements.Name: EFS access points should enforce a root directory
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon EFS access points are configured to enforce a root directory. The control fails if the value of Path is set to / (the default root directory of the file system).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EFS resources.

Requirements.Name: EFS access points should enforce a user identity
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon EFS access points are configured to enforce a user identity. This control fails if a POSIX user identity is not defined while creating the EFS access point.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EFS resources.

Requirements.Name: EKS cluster endpoints should not be publicly accessible
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster endpoint is publicly accessible. The control fails if an EKS cluster has an endpoint that is publicly accessible.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EKS resources.

Requirements.Name: EKS clusters should run on a supported Kubernetes version
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster is running on a supported Kubernetes version. The control fails if the EKS cluster is running on an unsupported version. If your application doesn't require a specific version of Kubernetes, we recommend that you use the latest available Kubernetes version that's supported by EKS for your clusters.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EKS resources.

Requirements.Name: EKS clusters should use encrypted Kubernetes secrets
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster uses encrypted Kubernetes secrets. The control fails if the cluster's Kubernetes secrets aren't encrypted.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EKS resources.

Requirements.Name: EKS clusters should have audit logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster has audit logging enabled. The control fails if audit logging isn't enabled for the cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EKS resources.

Requirements.Name: Application Load Balancer should be configured to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured on all HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers. The control fails if any of the HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers do not have HTTP to HTTPS redirection configured.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Classic Load Balancers with SSL/HTTPS listeners should use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the Classic Load Balancer uses HTTPS/SSL certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager (ACM). The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer configured with HTTPS/SSL listener does not use a certificate provided by ACM.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Classic Load Balancer listeners should be configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your Classic Load Balancer listeners are configured with HTTPS or TLS protocol for front-end (client to load balancer) connections. The control is applicable if a Classic Load Balancer has listeners. If your Classic Load Balancer does not have a listener configured, then the control does not report any findings. The control passes if the Classic Load Balancer listeners are configured with TLS or HTTPS for front-end connections. The control fails if the listener is not configured with TLS or HTTPS for front-end connections.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Application load balancers should be configured to drop HTTP headers
Requirements.Description: This control evaluates AWS Application Load Balancers (ALB) to ensure they are configured to drop invalid HTTP headers. The control fails if the value of routing.http.drop_invalid_header_fields.enabled is set to false. By default, ALBs are not configured to drop invalid HTTP header values. Removing these header values prevents HTTP desync attacks.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Application and Classic Load Balancers logging should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the Application Load Balancer and the Classic Load Balancer have logging enabled. The control fails if access_logs.s3.enabled is false.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Application Load Balancer deletion protection should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Application Load Balancer has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if deletion protection is not configured. Enable deletion protection to protect your Application Load Balancer from deletion.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Classic Load Balancers should have connection draining enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Classic Load Balancers have connection draining enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Classic Load Balancers should have cross-zone load balancing enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if cross-zone load balancing is enabled for the Classic Load Balancers (CLBs). This control fails if cross-zone load balancing is not enabled for a CLB.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Classic Load Balancers should span multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer has been configured to span multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer does not span multiple Availability Zones.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Application Load Balancers should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Application Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode. The control fails if an Application Load Balancer is not configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Application, Network, and Gateway Load Balancers should span multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Elastic Load Balancer V2 (Application, Network, or Gateway Load Balancer) has registered instances from multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if an Elastic Load Balancer V2 has instances registered in fewer than two Availability Zones.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Classic Load Balancers should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode. This control will fail if the Classic Load Balancer is not configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Application Load Balancers should be associated with an AWS WAF web ACL
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Application Load Balancer is associated with an AWS WAF Classic or AWS WAF web access control list (web ACL). The control fails if the Enabled field for the AWS WAF configuration is set to false.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ELB resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EMR cluster primary nodes should not have public IP addresses
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether master nodes on Amazon EMR clusters have public IP addresses. The control fails if the master node has public IP addresses that are associated with any of its instances. Public IP addresses are designated in the PublicIp field of the NetworkInterfaces configuration for the instance. This control only checks Amazon EMR clusters that are in a RUNNING or WAITING state.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EMR resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon EMR block public access setting should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your account is configured with Amazon EMR block public access. The control fails if the block public access setting isn't enabled or if any port other than port 22 is allowed.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EMR resources.

Requirements.Name: Elasticsearch domains should have encryption at-rest enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES) domains have encryption at rest configuration enabled. The check fails if encryption at rest is not enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Elasticsearch domains should not be publicly accessible
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elasticsearch Service domains are in a VPC. It does not evaluate the VPC subnet routing configuration to determine public access. You should ensure that Amazon ES domains are not attached to public subnets.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Elasticsearch Service domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon ES domains have node-to-node encryption enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Elasticsearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Elasticsearch domains should have audit logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have audit logging enabled. This control fails if an Elasticsearch domain does not have audit logging enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Elasticsearch domains should have at least three data nodes
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Elasticsearch domains should be configured with at least three dedicated master nodes
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three dedicated master nodes. This control fails if the domain does not use dedicated master nodes. This control passes if Elasticsearch domains have five dedicated master nodes. However, using more than three master nodes might be unnecessary to mitigate the availability risk, and will result in additional cost.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Connections to Elasticsearch domains should be encrypted using the latest TLS security policy
Requirements.Description: This controls checks whether an Elasticsearch domain endpoint is configured to use the latest TLS security policy. The control fails if the Elasticsearch domain endpoint isn't configured to use the latest supported policy or if HTTPs isn't enabled. The current latest supported TLS security policy is Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-PFS-2023-10.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elasticsearch resources.

Requirements.Name: ElastiCache for Redis clusters should have automatic backups scheduled
Requirements.Description: This control evaluates if Amazon ElastiCache for Redis clusters have automatic backup scheduled. The control fails if the SnapshotRetentionLimit for the Redis cluster is less than 1.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: Minor version upgrades should be automatically applied to ElastiCache for Redis cache clusters
Requirements.Description: This control evaluates whether ElastiCache for Redis automatically applies minor version upgrades to cache clusters. This control fails if ElastiCache for Redis cache clusters do not have minor version upgrades automatically applied.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: ElastiCache for Redis replication groups should have automatic failover enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ElastiCache for Redis replication groups have automatic failover enabled. This control fails if automatic failover isn't enabled for a Redis replication group.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: ElastiCache for Redis replication groups should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ElastiCache for Redis replication groups are encrypted at rest. This control fails if an ElastiCache for Redis replication group isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: ElastiCache for Redis replication groups should be encrypted in transit
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ElastiCache for Redis replication groups are encrypted in transit. This control fails if an ElastiCache for Redis replication group isn't encrypted in transit.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: ElastiCache for Redis replication groups before version 6.0 should use Redis AUTH
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ElastiCache for Redis replication groups have Redis AUTH enabled. The control fails for an ElastiCache for Redis replication group if the Redis version of its nodes is below 6.0 and AuthToken isn't in use.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: ElastiCache clusters should not use the default subnet group
Requirements.Description: This control checks if ElastiCache clusters are configured with a custom subnet group. The control fails for an ElastiCache cluster if CacheSubnetGroupName has the value default.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring ElastiCache resources.

Requirements.Name: Elastic Beanstalk environments should have enhanced health reporting enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether enhanced health reporting is enabled for your AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments.Elastic Beanstalk enhanced health reporting enables a more rapid response to changes in the health of the underlying infrastructure. These changes could result in a lack of availability of the application.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elastic Beanstalk resources.

Requirements.Name: Elastic Beanstalk should stream logs to CloudWatch
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Elastic Beanstalk environment is configured to send logs to CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if an Elastic Beanstalk environment isn't configured to send logs to CloudWatch Logs. Optionally, you can provide a custom value for the RetentionInDays parameter if you want the control to pass only if logs are retained for the specified number of days before expiration.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Elastic Beanstalk resources.

Requirements.Name: EventBridge custom event buses should have a resource-based policy attached
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an Amazon EventBridge custom event bus has a resource-based policy attached. This control fails if the custom event bus doesn't have a resource-based policy.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring EventBridge resources.

Requirements.Name: FSx for OpenZFS file systems should be configured to copy tags to backups and volumes
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file system is configured to copy tags to backups and volumes. The control fails if the OpenZFS file system isn't configured to copy tags to backups and volumes.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring FSx resources.

Requirements.Name: GuardDuty should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon GuardDuty is enabled in your GuardDuty account and Region. It is highly recommended that you enable GuardDuty in all supported AWS Regions. Doing so allows GuardDuty to generate findings about unauthorized or unusual activity, even in Regions that you do not actively use. This also allows GuardDuty to monitor CloudTrail events for global AWS services such as IAM.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring GuardDuty resources.

Requirements.Name: GuardDuty RDS Protection should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty RDS Protection is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty RDS Protection is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have RDS Protection enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring GuardDuty resources.

Requirements.Name: GuardDuty S3 Protection should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty S3 Protection is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty S3 Protection is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have S3 Protection enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring GuardDuty resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM policies should not allow full '*' administrative privileges
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the default version of IAM policies (also known as customer managed policies) has administrator access that includes a statement with 'Effect': 'Allow' with 'Action': '*' over 'Resource': '*'. The control only checks the customer managed policies that you create. It does not check inline and AWS managed policies.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM users should not have IAM policies attached
Requirements.Description: This control checks that none of your IAM users have policies attached. Instead, IAM users must inherit permissions from IAM groups or roles.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM users' access keys should be rotated every 90 days or less
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the active access keys are rotated within 90 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM root user access key should not exist
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the root user access key is present. The root account is the most privileged user in an AWS account. AWS access keys provide programmatic access to a given account.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: MFA should be enabled for all IAM users that have a console password
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether AWS multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled for all IAM users that use a console password.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: Hardware MFA should be enabled for the root user
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your AWS account is enabled to use a hardware multi-factor authentication (MFA) device to sign in with root user credentials.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: Password policies for IAM users should have strong configurations
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the account password policy for IAM users uses the recommended configurations.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: Unused IAM user credentials should be removed
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your IAM users have passwords or active access keys that have not been used for 90 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: MFA should be enabled for the root user
Requirements.Description: The root user has complete access to all the services and resources in an AWS account. MFA adds an extra layer of protection on top of a user name and password. With MFA enabled, when a user signs in to the AWS Management Console, they're prompted for their user name and password and for an authentication code from their AWS MFA device.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: Password policies for IAM users should have strong AWS Configurations
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the account password policy for IAM users uses the following minimum PCI DSS configurations.RequireUppercaseCharacters â Require at least one uppercase character in password. (Default = true)RequireLowercaseCharacters â Require at least one lowercase character in password. (Default = true)RequireNumbers â Require at least one number in password. (Default = true)MinimumPasswordLength â Password minimum length. (Default = 7 or longer)PasswordReusePrevention â Number of passwords before allowing reuse. (Default = 4)MaxPasswordAge â Number of days before password expiration. (Default = 90).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: MFA should be enabled for all IAM users
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the IAM users have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM customer managed policies that you create should not allow wildcard actions for services
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the IAM identity-based policies that you create have Allow statements that use the * wildcard to grant permissions for all actions on any service. The control fails if any policy statement includes 'Effect': 'Allow' with 'Action': 'Service:*'.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM user credentials unused for 45 days should be removed
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your IAM users have passwords or active access keys that have not been used for 45 days or more. To do so, it checks whether the maxCredentialUsageAge parameter of the AWS Config rule is equal to 45 or more.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: Expired SSL/TLS certificates managed in IAM should be removed
Requirements.Description: This controls checks whether an active SSL/TLS server certificate that is managed in IAM has expired. The control fails if the expired SSL/TLS server certificate isn't removed.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring IAM resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM customer managed policies should not allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
Requirements.Description: Checks whether the default version of IAM customer managed policies allow principals to use the AWS KMS decryption actions on all resources. This control uses Zelkova, an automated reasoning engine, to validate and warn you about policies that may grant broad access to your secrets across AWS accounts. This control fails if the kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys. The control evaluates both attached and unattached customer managed policies. It does not check inline policies or AWS managed policies.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring KMS resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM principals should not have IAM inline policies that allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
Requirements.Description: Checks whether the inline policies that are embedded in your IAM identities (role, user, or group) allow the AWS KMS decryption actions on all KMS keys. This control uses Zelkova, an automated reasoning engine, to validate and warn you about policies that may grant broad access to your secrets across AWS accounts. This control fails if kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys in an inline policy.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring KMS resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS KMS keys should not be unintentionally deleted
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether AWS KMS customer managed keys (CMK) are scheduled for deletion. The control fails if a CMK is scheduled for deletion. CMKs cannot be recovered once deleted. Data encrypted under a KMS CMK is also permanently unrecoverable if the CMK is deleted. If meaningful data has been encrypted under a CMK scheduled for deletion,consider decrypting the data or re-encrypting the data under a new CMK unless you are intentionally performing a cryptographic erasure.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring KMS resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS KMS key rotation should be enabled
Requirements.Description: TAWS KMS enables customers to rotate the backing key, which is key material stored in AWS KMS and is tied to the key ID of the KMS key. It's the backing key that is used to perform cryptographic operations such as encryption and decryption. Automated key rotation currently retains all previous backing keys so that decryption of encrypted data can take place transparently.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring KMS resources.

Requirements.Name: KMS keys should not be publicly accessible
Requirements.Description: This controls checks whether an AWS KMS key is publicly accessible. The control fails if the KMS key is publicly accessible.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring KMS resources.

Requirements.Name: Kinesis Data Streams should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Kinesis Data Streams are encrypted at rest with server-side encryption. This control fails if a Kinesis stream is not encrypted at rest with server-side encryption.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Kinesis resources.

Requirements.Name: Lambda function policies should prohibit public access
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the Lambda function resource-based policy prohibits public access outside of your account. The Lambda function should not be publicly accessible, as this may allow unintended access to your code stored in the function.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Lambda resources.

Requirements.Name: Lambda functions should use supported runtimes
Requirements.Description: This control checks that the Lambda function settings for runtimes match the expected values set for the latest runtimes for each supported language. This control checks for the following runtimes: dotnet8, dotnet6, java21, java17, java11, java8.al2, nodejs22.x, nodejs20.x, nodejs18.x, python3.13, python3.12, python3.11, python3.10, python3.9, python3.8, ruby3.3, ruby3.2

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Lambda resources.

Requirements.Name: Lambda functions should be in a VPC
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Lambda function is deployed in a virtual private cloud (VPC). The control fails if the Lambda function isn't deployed in a VPC. Security Hub doesn't evaluate the VPC subnet routing configuration to determine public reachability. You might see failed findings for Lambda@Edge resources.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Lambda resources.

Requirements.Name: VPC Lambda functions should operate in multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an AWS Lambda function that connects to a virtual private cloud (VPC) operates in at least the specified number of Availability Zone (AZs). The control fails if the function doesn't operate in at least the specified number of AZs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Lambda resources.

Requirements.Name: MSK clusters should be encrypted in transit among broker nodes
Requirements.Description: This controls checks if an Amazon MSK cluster is encrypted in transit with HTTPS (TLS) among the broker nodes of the cluster. The control fails if plain text communication is enabled for a cluster broker node connection.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring MSK resources.

Requirements.Name: MSK clusters should have enhanced monitoring configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon MSK cluster has enhanced monitoring configured, specified by a monitoring level of at least PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER. The control fails if the monitoring level for the cluster is set to DEFAULT or PER_BROKER.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring MSK resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Macie should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Macie is enabled for an account. The control fails if Macie isn't enabled for the account.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Macie resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster publishes audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster doesn't publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs. EnableCloudWatchLogsExport should be set to Audit.
