Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB cluster snapshots should not be public
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune manual DB cluster snapshot is public. The control fails if a Neptune manual DB cluster snapshot is public.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should have deletion protection enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should have automated backups enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster has automated backups enabled, and a backup retention period greater than or equal to 7 days. The control fails if backups aren't enabled for the Neptune DB cluster, or if the retention period is less than 7 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB cluster snapshots should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster snapshot is encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should have IAM database authentication enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster has IAM database authentication enabled. The control fails if IAM database authentication isn't enabled for a Neptune DB cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
Requirements.Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster is configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster isn't configured to copy tags to snapshots.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Neptune DB clusters should be deployed across multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Neptune DB cluster has read-replica instances in multiple Availability Zones (AZs). The control fails if the cluster is deployed in only one AZ.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Neptune resources.

Requirements.Name: Network Firewall logging should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled for an AWS Network Firewall firewall. The control fails if logging isn't enabled for at least one log type or if the logging destination doesn't exist.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Network Firewall resources.

Requirements.Name: Network Firewall policies should have at least one rule group associated
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Network Firewall policy has any stateful or stateless rule groups associated. The control fails if stateless or stateful rule groups are not assigned.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Network Firewall resources.

Requirements.Name: The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for full packets
Requirements.Description: A firewall policy defines how your firewall monitors and handles traffic in Amazon VPC. You configure stateless and stateful rule groups to filter packets and traffic flows. Defaulting to Pass can allow unintended traffic.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Network Firewall resources.

Requirements.Name: The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for fragmented packets
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the default stateless action for fragmented packets for a Network Firewall policy is drop or forward. The control passes if Drop or Forward is selected, and fails if Pass is selected.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Network Firewall resources.

Requirements.Name: Stateless network firewall rule group should not be empty
Requirements.Description: A rule group contains rules that define how your firewall processes traffic in your VPC. An empty stateless rule group when present in a firewall policy might give the impression that the rule group will process traffic. However, when the stateless rule group is empty, it does not process traffic.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Network Firewall resources.

Requirements.Name: Network Firewall firewalls should have deletion protection enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Network Firewall firewall has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if deletion protection isn't enabled for a firewall.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Network Firewall resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should have encryption at rest enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains have encryption-at-rest configuration enabled. The check fails if encryption at rest is not enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should not be publicly accessible
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains are in a VPC. It does not evaluate the VPC subnet routing configuration to determine public access.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains have node-to-node encryption enabled. This control fails if node-to-node encryption is disabled on the domain.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs. This control fails if error logging to CloudWatch is not enabled for a domain.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should have audit logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains have audit logging enabled. This control fails if an OpenSearch domain does not have audit logging enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should have at least three data nodes
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zoneAwarenessEnabled is true. This control fails for an OpenSearch domain if instanceCount is less than 3 or zoneAwarenessEnabled is false.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should have fine-grained access control enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether OpenSearch domains have fine-grained access control enabled. The control fails if the fine-grained access control is not enabled. Fine-grained access control requires advanced-security-optionsin the OpenSearch parameter update-domain-config to be enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: Connections to OpenSearch domains should be encrypted using the latest TLS security policy
Requirements.Description: TThis controls checks whether an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain endpoint is configured to use the latest TLS security policy. The control fails if the OpenSearch domain endpoint isn't configured to use the latest supported policy or if HTTPs isn't enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: OpenSearch domains should have the latest software update installed
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain has the latest software update installed. The control fails if a software update is available but not installed for the domain.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring OpenSearch resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS Private CA root certificate authority should be disabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if AWS Private CA has a root certificate authority (CA) that is disabled. The control fails if the root CA is enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Private Certificate Authority resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS snapshots should be private
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS snapshots are public. This control is intended for RDS instances. It can also return findings for snapshots of Aurora DB instances, Neptune DB instances, and Amazon DocumentDB clusters, even though they are not evaluated for public accessibility. If these findings are not useful, you can suppress them.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should prohibit public access, determined by the PubliclyAccessible configuration
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS instances are publicly accessible by evaluating the PubliclyAccessible field in the instance configuration item. Neptune DB instances and Amazon DocumentDB clusters do not have the PubliclyAccessible flag and cannot be evaluated. However, this control can still generate findings for these resources. You can suppress these findings.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should have encryption at-rest enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether storage encryption is enabled for your Amazon RDS DB instances. This control is intended for RDS DB instances. However, it can also generate findings for Aurora DB instances, Neptune DB instances, and Amazon DocumentDB clusters. If these findings are not useful, then you can suppress them.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB snapshots are encrypted. This control is intended for RDS DB instances. However, it can also generate findings for snapshots of Aurora DB instances, Neptune DB instances, and Amazon DocumentDB clusters. If these findings are not useful, then you can suppress them.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should be configured with multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB instances. RDS DB instances should be configured for multiple Availability Zones (AZs). This ensures the availability of the data stored. Multi-AZ deployments allow for automated failover if there is an issue with Availability Zone availability and during regular RDS maintenance.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Enhanced monitoring should be configured for RDS DB instances and clusters
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether enhanced monitoring is enabled for your RDS DB instances. In Amazon RDS, Enhanced Monitoring enables a more rapid response to performance changes in underlying infrastructure. These performance changes could result in a lack of availability of the data. Enhanced Monitoring provides real-time metrics of the operating system that your RDS DB instance runs on. An agent is installed on the instance. The agent can obtain metrics more accurately than is possible from the hypervisor layer.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS clusters should have deletion protection enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether RDS clusters have deletion protection enabled. This control is intended for RDS DB instances. However, it can also generate findings for Aurora DB instances, Neptune DB instances, and Amazon DocumentDB clusters. If these findings are not useful,then you can suppress them.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should have deletion protection enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your RDS DB instances that use one of the listed database engines have deletion protection enabled. DatabaseEngines: mariadb,mysql,oracle-ee,oracle-se2,oracle-se1,oracle-se,postgres,sqlserver-ee,sqlserver-se,sqlserver-ex,sqlserver-web.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the logs of Amazon RDS are enabled and sent to CloudWatch Logs. RDS databases should have relevant logs enabled. Database logging provides detailed records of requests made to RDS. Database logs can assist with security and access audits and can help to diagnose availability issues.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM authentication should be configured for RDS instances
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB instance has IAM database authentication enabled IAM database authentication allows authentication to database instances with an authentication token instead of a password. Network traffic to and from the database is encrypted using SSL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS instances should have automatic backups enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Relational Database Service instances have automated backups enabled and the backup retention period is greater than or equal to seven days. The control fails if backups are not enabled, and if the retention period is less than 7 days.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: IAM authentication should be configured for RDS clusters
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB cluster has IAM database authentication enabled. IAM database authentication allows for password-free authentication to database instances. The authentication uses an authentication token. Network traffic to and from the database is encrypted using SSL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS automatic minor version upgrades should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether automatic minor version upgrades are enabled for the RDS database instance. Enabling automatic minor version upgrades ensures that the latest minor version updates to the relational database management system (RDBMS) are installed. These upgrades might include security patches and bug fixes. Keeping up to date with patch installation is an important step in securing systems.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Aurora clusters should have backtracking enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Aurora clusters have backtracking enabled. Backups help you to recover more quickly from a security incident. They also strengthens the resilience of your systems. Aurora backtracking reduces the time to recover a database to a point in time. It does not require a database restore to so.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB clusters should be configured for multiple Availability Zones
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB clusters. RDS DB clusters should be configured for multiple Availability Zones to ensure availability of the data that is stored.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB clusters should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB clusters are configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances are configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS instances should be deployed in a VPC
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an RDS instance is deployed in a VPC (EC2-VPC).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Existing RDS event notification subscriptions should be configured for critical cluster events.
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS event subscription exists that has notifications enabled for the following source type, event category key-value pairs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Existing RDS event notification subscriptions should be configured for critical database instance events
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS event subscription exists with notifications enabled for the following source type, event category key-value pairs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database parameter group events
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS event subscription exists with notifications enabled for the following source type, event category key-value pairs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database security group events
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS event subscription exists with notifications enabled for the following source type, event category key-value pairs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS databases and clusters should not use a database engine default port
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the RDS cluster or instance uses a port other than the default port of the database engine.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS database clusters should use a custom administrator username
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS database cluster has changed the admin username from its default value. This rule will fail if the admin username is set to the default value.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS database instances should use a custom administrator username
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether you've changed the administrative username for Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database instances from the default value. The control fails if the administrative username is set to the default value.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB instances should be protected by a backup plan
Requirements.Description: This control evaluates if Amazon RDS DB instances are covered by a backup plan. This control fails if the RDS DB instance isn't covered by a backup plan. If you set the backupVaultLockCheck parameter equal to true, the control passes only if the instance is backed up in an AWS Backup locked vault.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB clusters should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an RDS DB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an RDS DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Aurora MySQL DB clusters should publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Aurora MySQL DB cluster is configured to publish audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the cluster isn't configured to publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS DB clusters should have automatic minor version upgrade enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrade is enabled for an Amazon RDS database cluster. The control fails if automatic minor version upgrade isn't enabled for an RDS cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS for PostgreSQL DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL DB instance is configured to publish logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the PostgreSQL DB instance isn't configured to publish the log types mentioned in the logTypes parameter to CloudWatch Logs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Aurora PostgreSQL DB clusters should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster is configured to publish logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster isn't configured to publish PostgreSQL logs to CloudWatch Logs.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS for PostgreSQL DB instances should be encrypted in transit
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a connection to an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL database (DB) instance is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the rds.force_ssl parameter for the parameter group associated with the instance is set to 0 (off). This control doesn't evaluate RDS DB instances that are part of a DB cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: RDS for MySQL DB instances should be encrypted in transit
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a connection to an Amazon RDS for MySQL database (DB) instance is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the rds.require_secure_transport parameter for the parameter group associated with the instance is set to 0 (off). This control doesn't evaluate RDS DB instances that are part of a DB cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring RDS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Redshift clusters should prohibit public access
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters are publicly accessible. It evaluates the PubliclyAccessible field in the cluster configuration item. The PubliclyAccessible attribute of the Amazon Redshift cluster configuration indicates whether the cluster is publicly accessible. When the cluster is configured with PubliclyAccessible set to true, it is an Internet-facing instance that has a publicly resolvable DNS name, which resolves to a public IP address. When the cluster is not publicly accessible, it is an internal instance with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address. Unless you intend for your cluster to be publicly accessible, the cluster should not be configured with PubliclyAccessible set to true.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Connections to Amazon Redshift clusters should be encrypted in transit
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether connections to Amazon Redshift clusters are required to use encryption in transit. The check fails if the Amazon Redshift cluster parameter require_SSL is not set to 1. TLS can be used to help prevent potential attackers from using person-in-the-middle or similar attacks to eavesdrop on or manipulate network traffic. Only encrypted connections over TLS should be allowed. Encrypting data in transit can affect performance. You should test your application with this feature to understand the performance profile and the impact of TLS.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Redshift clusters should have automatic snapshots enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters have automated snapshots enabled. It also checks whether the snapshot retention period is greater than or equal to seven.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Redshift clusters should have audit logging enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has audit logging enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Redshift should have automatic upgrades to major versions enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether automatic major version upgrades are enabled for the Amazon Redshift cluster.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Redshift clusters should use enhanced VPC routing
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has EnhancedVpcRouting enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon Redshift clusters should not use the default Admin username
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a Amazon Redshift cluster has changed the admin username from its default value. This control will fail if the admin username for a Redshift cluster is set to awsuser.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Redshift clusters should not use the default database name
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has changed the database name from its default value. The control will fail if the database name for a Redshift cluster is set to dev.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Redshift clusters should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon Redshift clusters are encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Redshift cluster isn't encrypted at rest or if the encryption key is different from the provided key in the rule parameter.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Redshift resources.

Requirements.Name: Route 53 public hosted zones should log DNS queries
Requirements.Description: This control checks if DNS query logging is enabled for an Amazon Route 53 public hosted zone. The control fails if DNS query logging isn't enabled for a Route 53 public hosted zone.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Route53 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the following Amazon S3 public access block settings are configured at the account level

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 buckets should prohibit public read access
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your S3 buckets allow public read access. It evaluates the Block Public Access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 buckets should prohibit public write access
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your S3 buckets allow public write access. It evaluates the block public access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 buckets should require requests to use Secure Socket Layer
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether S3 buckets have policies that require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL). S3 buckets should have policies that require all requests (Action: S3:*)to only accept transmission of data over HTTPS in the S3 resource policy, indicated by the condition key aws:SecureTransport.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon S3 permissions granted to other AWS accounts in bucket policies should be restricted
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the S3 bucket policy prevents principals from other AWS accounts from performing denied actions on resources in the S3 bucket.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 general purpose buckets should use cross-Region replication
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket has cross-Region replication enabled. The control fails if the bucket doesn't have cross-Region replication enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled at the bucket level
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether S3 buckets have bucket-level public access blocks applied.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 bucket server access logging should be enabled
Requirements.Description: When logging is enabled, Amazon S3 delivers access logs for a source bucket to a chosen target bucket. The target bucket must be in the same AWS Region as the source bucket and must not have a default retention period configuration.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 buckets with versioning enabled should have lifecycle policies configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks if Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) version enabled buckets have lifecycle policy configured. This rule fails if Amazon S3 lifecycle policy is not enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 buckets should have event notifications enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether S3 Event Notifications are enabled on an Amazon S3 bucket. This control fails if S3 Event Notifications are not enabled on a bucket.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 access control lists (ACLs) should not be used to manage user access to buckets
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon S3 buckets provide user permissions via ACLs. The control fails if ACLs are configured for managing user access on S3 buckets.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 buckets should have lifecycle policies configured
Requirements.Description: This control checks if a lifecycle policy is configured for an Amazon S3 bucket. This control fails if a lifecycle policy is not configured for an S3 bucket.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 general purpose buckets should have versioning enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket has versioning enabled. The control fails if versioning is suspended for the bucket.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 general purpose buckets should have Object Lock enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket has Object Lock enabled. The control fails if Object Lock isn't enabled for the bucket. If you provide a custom value for the mode parameter, the control passes only if S3 Object Lock uses the specified retention mode.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 general purpose buckets should be encrypted at rest with AWS KMS keys
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket is encrypted with an AWS KMS key (SSE-KMS or DSSE-KMS). The control fails if the bucket is encrypted with default encryption (SSE-S3).

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 access points should have block public access settings enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 access point has block public access settings enabled. The control fails if block public access settings aren't enabled for the access point.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: S3 general purpose buckets should have MFA delete enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether multi-factor authentication (MFA) delete is enabled on an Amazon S3 general purpose versioned bucket. The control fails if MFA delete is not enabled on the bucket. The control doesn't produce findings for buckets that have a Lifecycle configuration.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring S3 resources.

Requirements.Name: SNS topics should be encrypted at rest using AWS KMS
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an SNS topic is encrypted at rest using AWS KMS.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SNS resources.

Requirements.Name: Logging of delivery status should be enabled for notification messages sent to a topic
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled for the delivery status of notification messages sent to an Amazon SNS topic for the endpoints. This control fails if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SNS resources.

Requirements.Name: SNS topic access policies should not allow public access
Requirements.Description: This control checks if the Amazon SNS topic access policy allows public access. This control fails if the SNS topic access policy allows public access.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SNS resources.

Requirements.Name: Amazon SQS queues should be encrypted at rest
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether Amazon SQS queues are encrypted at rest.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SQS resources.

Requirements.Name: EC2 instances should be managed by AWS Systems Manager
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the EC2 instances in your account are managed by AWS Systems Manager. Systems Manager is an AWS service that you can use to view and control your AWS infrastructure. To help you to maintain security and compliance, Systems Manager scans your managed instances. A managed instance is a machine that is configured for use with Systems Manager. Systems Manager then reports or takes corrective action on any policy violations that it detects. Systems Manager also helps you to configure and maintain your managed instances.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SSM resources.

Requirements.Name: All EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should be compliant with patching requirements
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the compliance status of the Amazon EC2 Systems Manager patch compliance is COMPLIANT or non compliant after the patch installation on the instance. It only checks instances that are managed by Systems Manager Patch Manager.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SSM resources.

Requirements.Name: Instances managed by Systems Manager should have an association compliance status of COMPLIANT
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether the status of the AWS Systems Manager association compliance is COMPLIANT or non compliant after the association is run on an instance. The control passes if the association compliance status is COMPLIANT.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SSM resources.

Requirements.Name: SSM documents should not be public
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether AWS Systems Manager documents that are owned by the account are public. This control fails if SSM documents with the owner Self are public.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SSM resources.

Requirements.Name: SageMaker notebook instances should not have direct internet access
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether direct internet access is disabled for an SageMaker notebook instance. To do this, it checks whether the DirectInternetAccess field is disabled for the notebook instance. If you configure your SageMaker instance without a VPC, then by default direct internet access is enabled on your instance. You should configure your instance with a VPC and change the default setting to Disable â Access the internet through a VPC.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SageMaker resources.

Requirements.Name: SageMaker notebook instances should be launched in a custom VPC
Requirements.Description: This control checks if an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance is launched within a custom virtual private cloud (VPC). This control fails if a SageMaker notebook instance is not launched within a custom VPC or if it is launched in the SageMaker service VPC.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SageMaker resources.

Requirements.Name: Users should not have root access to SageMaker notebook instances
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether root access is turned on for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance. The control fails if root access is turned on for a SageMaker notebook instance.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SageMaker resources.

Requirements.Name: SageMaker AI endpoint production variants should have an initial instance count greater than 1
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether production variants of an Amazon SageMaker AI endpoint have an initial instance count greater than 1. The control fails if the endpoint's production variants have only 1 initial instance.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SageMaker resources.

Requirements.Name: SageMaker models should block inbound traffic
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SageMaker AI hosted model blocks inbound network traffic. The control fails if the EnableNetworkIsolation parameter for the hosted model is set to False.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring SageMaker resources.

Requirements.Name: Secrets Manager secrets should have automatic rotation enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a secret stored in AWS Secrets Manager is configured with automatic rotation. Secrets Manager helps you improve the security posture of your organization. Secrets include database credentials, passwords, and third-party API keys. You can use Secrets Manager to store secrets centrally, encrypt secrets automatically, control access to secrets, and rotate secrets safely and automatically.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Secrets Manager resources.

Requirements.Name: Secrets Manager secrets configured with automatic rotation should rotate successfully
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Secrets Manager secret rotated successfully based on the rotation schedule. The control fails if RotationOccurringAsScheduled is false. The control does not evaluate secrets that do not have rotation configured.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Secrets Manager resources.

Requirements.Name: Remove unused Secrets Manager secrets
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Secrets Manager secret has been accessed within the specified time frame. The control fails if a secret is unused beyond the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the access period, Security Hub uses a default value of 90 days

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Secrets Manager resources.

Requirements.Name: Secrets Manager secrets should be rotated within a specified number of days
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether your secrets have been rotated at least once within 90 days. Rotating secrets can help you to reduce the risk of an unauthorized use of your secrets in your AWS account. Examples include database credentials, passwords, third-party API keys, and even arbitrary text. If you do not change your secrets for a long period of time, the secrets are more likely to be compromised.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Secrets Manager resources.

Requirements.Name: Step Functions state machines should have logging turned on
Requirements.Description: This controls checks whether an AWS Step Functions state machine has logging turned on. The control fails if a state machine doesn't have logging turned on. If you provide a custom value for the logLevel parameter, the control passes only if the state machine has the specified logging level turned on.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring Step Functions resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic Global Web ACL logging should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled for an AWS WAF global web ACL. This control fails if logging is not enabled for the web ACL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic Regional rules should have at least one condition
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Regional rule has at least one condition. The control fails if no conditions are present within a rule.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic Regional rule groups should have at least one rule
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Regional rule group has at least one rule. The control fails if no rules are present within a rule group.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic Regional web ACLs should have at least one rule or rule group
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic Regional web ACL contains any WAF rules or WAF rule groups. This control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rules or rule groups.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic global rules should have at least one condition
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF global rule contains any conditions. The control fails if no conditions are present within a rule.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic global rule groups should have at least one rule
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF global rule group has at least one rule. The control fails if no rules are present within a rule group.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF Classic global web ACLs should have at least one rule or rule group
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF global web ACL contains at least one WAF rule or WAF rule group. The control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rules or rule groups.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF web ACLs should have at least one rule or rule group
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether a WAFV2 web access control list (web ACL) contains at least one WAF rule or WAF rule group. The control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rules or rule groups.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF web ACL logging should be enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether logging is activated for an AWS WAFV2 web access control list (web ACL). This control fails if logging is deactivated for the web ACL.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.

Requirements.Name: AWS WAF rules should have CloudWatch metrics enabled
Requirements.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF rule or rule group has Amazon CloudWatch metrics enabled. The control fails if the rule or rule group doesn't have CloudWatch metrics enabled.

Attributes.SectionDescription: This section contains recommendations for configuring WAF resources.
